iwillsurvive 0.1.1.9000

Create an iwillsurvive object

iwillsurvive.Rd

Create an iwillsurvive object

iwillsurvive(
  cohort,
  followup_time = "followup_months",
  event_status = "event_status",
  patient_id = "patientid",
  terms = NULL,
  type = "right",
  fit = NULL,
  event_title = NULL,
  index_title = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  followup_time_units = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

cohort

dataframe. A one-row-per-patient dataframe
followup_time

character.
event_status

character.
patient_id

character.
terms

character.
type

character. See ?survival::survfit.formula
fit

survfit. An optional survfit object created from survival:survfit(). If specified, no additional model(s) will be fit.
event_title

character.
index_title

character.
title

character.
followup_time_units

character. Units used in followup time
verbose

logical. If TRUE, return messages

Value

survfit. See ?survival::survfit.object to learn more

Examples


cohort <- data.frame(
  patientid = 1:20,
  followup_months = c(
    6.1, 15.4, 22, 24.6, 25.6, 26.1, 28.7, 46.9, 54.5, 55, 62.2,
    65.5, 88.1, 108.5, 116, 119.1, 119.6, 169.1, 317.8, 381.7
  ),
  event_status = c(
    FALSE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE,
    TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE
  ),
  group = c(
    "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b",
    "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b"
  )
)

# Ignoring group term

cohort_fit <- iwillsurvive(cohort)

#> ── iwillsurvive ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> - 13 of 20 (65%) patient(s) experienced the event.
#> - survival::survfit(survival::Surv(followup_months, event_status, type = 'right') ~ 1, data = cohort)
#> - Median Survival = 88.1
cohort_fit

#> $cohort
#>    patientid followup_months event_status group
#> 1          1             6.1        FALSE     a
#> 2          2            15.4        FALSE     b
#> 3          3            22.0         TRUE     a
#> 4          4            24.6         TRUE     b
#> 5          5            25.6         TRUE     a
#> 6          6            26.1         TRUE     b
#> 7          7            28.7        FALSE     a
#> 8          8            46.9         TRUE     b
#> 9          9            54.5         TRUE     a
#> 10        10            55.0        FALSE     b
#> 11        11            62.2         TRUE     a
#> 12        12            65.5         TRUE     b
#> 13        13            88.1         TRUE     a
#> 14        14           108.5         TRUE     b
#> 15        15           116.0        FALSE     a
#> 16        16           119.1         TRUE     b
#> 17        17           119.6         TRUE     a
#> 18        18           169.1         TRUE     b
#> 19        19           317.8        FALSE     a
#> 20        20           381.7        FALSE     b
#> 
#> $fit
#> Call: survfit(formula = survival::Surv(followup_months, event_status, 
#>     type = "right") ~ 1, data = cohort)
#> 
#>       n  events  median 0.95LCL 0.95UCL 
#>    20.0    13.0    88.1    54.5      NA 
#> 
#> $terms
#> NULL
#> 
#> $event_title
#> NULL
#> 
#> $index_title
#> NULL
#> 
#> $followup_time_col
#> [1] "followup_months"
#> 
#> $followup_time_units
#> [1] "months"
#> 
#> $timeatrisk_col
#> [1] "followup_months"
#> 
#> $event_status_col
#> [1] "event_status"
#> 
#> $patientid_col
#> [1] "patientid"
#> 
#> $title
#> NULL
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "iwillsurvive"

# Now including some covariates

cohort_fit <- iwillsurvive(cohort,
                           terms = "group")

#> ── iwillsurvive ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> - 13 of 20 (65%) patient(s) experienced the event.
#> - survival::survfit(survival::Surv(followup_months, event_status, type = 'right') ~ group, data = cohort)

cohort_fit
